identified-content.person: TURNER, DR. SHAIRI REBECCA (DR. SHAIRI REBECCA DAVIS)

block.p: Dr. Shairi Rebecca Turner, the daughter of Beth Turner and Charles E. Turner, both of New York, was married yesterday to Dr. Jimmie Lee Davis Jr., a son of Doris Scott Henry of Miami and Mr. Davis of Lauderhill, Fla. The Rev. Dr. Cheryl Townsend Gilkes, a Baptist minister, officiated at Studio 450, a loft space in New York.

Dr. Turner-Davis, 30, completed a combined residency in pediatrics and internal medicine last month at Massachusetts General Hospital and Children's Hospital, both in Boston. In September, she is to become the director of minority recruitment at Mass General. She will also do clinical work at the Chelsea Urgent Care Center, which is a unit of Mass General in Chelsea, Mass. She graduated from Stanford University and received her medical degree from Case Western Reserve University.

Dr. Shairi Rebecca Turner, the daughter of Beth Turner and Charles E. Turner, both of New York, was married yesterday to Dr. Jimmie Lee Davis Jr., a son of Doris Scott Henry of Miami and Mr. Davis of Lauderhill, Fla. The Rev. Dr. Cheryl Townsend Gilkes, a Baptist minister, officiated at Studio 450, a loft space in New York.

Dr. Turner-Davis, 30, completed a combined residency in pediatrics and internal medicine last month at Massachusetts General Hospital and Children's Hospital, both in Boston. In September, she is to become the director of minority recruitment at Mass General. She will also do clinical work at the Chelsea Urgent Care Center, which is a unit of Mass General in Chelsea, Mass. She graduated from Stanford University and received her medical degree from Case Western Reserve University.

Her father, an actor, appeared in January in ''Midnight Special'' at the Playwrights Theater in Madison, N.J. Her mother is the coordinator of student advisement and special projects and an adjunct drama professor at New York University.

In August, Dr. Davis, 32, is to become a senior engineer at the Mitre Corporation, a military contractor in Bedford, Mass. He received a bachelor's degree in physics and mathematics from Morehouse College and another in electrical engineering from the Georgia Institute of Technology. He also holds a master's degree in applied mathematics from Georgia Tech and a doctorate in electrical engineering from the University of Massachusetts. His mother retired as a sales associate at the Levitz furniture store in Miami. His father is a lithographer at Associated Printing Production, also in Miami. The bridegroom is a stepson of Lesly Henry Jr.
